title-group.article-title: Measuring Trends in Sales Concentration in American Business

abstract.p: Four indexes are employed to measure trends in sales concentration of large business in the United States between 1967 and 1992 using Fortune 500 data. This paper also investigates whether a perceptible change occurred during the 1980s. Each of the indexes confirms increasing concentration for the whole period 1967 to 1992 for all 500, the top 100, and the second 100 firms. The increase in the trend of concentration during the 1980s was not statistically significant for all the 500 firms as well as sets of 100 firms of lower rank.
